Name.label: Global developmental delay-visual anomalies-progressive cerebellar atrophy-truncal hypotonia syndrome
Syndrome with a cerebellar malformation as major feature
Rare genetic ophthalmic disorder with cortical involvement
Genetic syndrome with a cerebellar malformation as major feature
Rare ophthalmic disorder with cortical involvement

TextSection.Contents: Global developmental delay-visual anomalies-progressive cerebellar atrophy-truncal hypotonia syndrome is a rare, genetic, neurological disorder characterized by mild to severe developmental delay and speech impairment, truncal hypotonia, abnormalities of vision (including cortical visual impairment and abnormal visual-evoked potentials), progressive brain atrophy mainly affecting the cerebellum, and shortened or atrophic corpus callosum. Other clinical findings may include increased muscle tone in the extremities, dystonic posturing, hyporeflexia, scoliosis, postnatal microcephaly and variable facial dysmorphism (e.g. deep-set eyes, gingival hyperplasia, short philtrum and retrognathia).

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
